Safety of our crews is major for us concern here in Project BABYLON. Our Search and Rescue (SAR) teams are hard at work every day training for they future deployment at Laythe. Flying modified KV-2 Griffon (comissioned as Grif SAR) with range of 210km and with cruising speed 360km/h (100m/s) while flying around 500m above sea level. This VTOL SAR craft is very stable, yet capable of maneuvering and landing on tight spots.Equiped with powerful lights and emergency beacon location system it is capable to search for stranded ships and Kerbals night or day, shine or rain!

We leave no Kerbal behind!

Basic flight demonstration:

Edited May 20, 2013 by Tada

If we're going for realism. I have an observation...

So clearly there is a potential threat to the colony, hence the presence of combat capable ships. Keeping the entire fleet around Laythe is, in my opinion, inefficient. It's also essentially waiting for the enemy at your doorstep. Not good tactics.

The majority of a hostile fleet entering the Joolian system, especially heavier ships with a low TWR, will burn for capture by Jool's influence, and burn mid-swing for a Laythe capture. This is where they would most vulnerable. At the speeds encountered during transfer a very slight change in trajectory, or interruption during a burn, would be enough to miss Laythe capture, launch them entirely out of the Joolian system, or bury them in Jool's atmosphere during aerobraking.

As the cruisers we have deployed are not highly maneuverable, I propose two small detachments of light interceptors with a high TWR capable of a "fly-by" be stationed opposite each other in Jool's orbit, possibly accompanied a small supply station with living quarters. They do not need to be heavily armed, nor do they need to outright destroy a heavy ship. They just need to be capable of knocking it off course or breaking a few parts off to destabilize it during aerobraking maneuvers. Anything that still manages to secure a Laythe intercept will be a little "softer" and traveling slow enough for the frigates with their high dollar smart missiles to cut off.

Taco Industries would like to present its first contribution to Project BABYLON. This is a heavy duty, 1 kerbal drop pod utility, rated for landing in extreme conditions, and at velocities of up to 50 m/s. This vehicle has undergone rigorous testing on Kerbin, Laythe, Duna, Jool, and even Eve and performed perfectly in each situation. Each drop pod comes pre-equipped with a de-orbit stage, as well as full RCS and SAS capabilities. During reentry, the pod makes use of a heat shield, which both protects the pod and slows the descent safely before deploying the parachutes and landing gear. Below, you will find the .craft file and a gallery of its most recent test on Laythe.

Gallery: http://imgur.com/a/5sveS#0
